title: Possession Of Marijuana Not A Crime, Says Top Brazil Court
content: A majority of the justices on Brazil's Supreme Court are in favor of decriminalizing the possession of marijuana for personal consumption, following a crucial vote on Tuesday.
summary: A majority of the justices on Brazil's Supreme Court are in favor of decriminalizing the possession of marijuana for personal consumption, following a crucial vote on Tuesday.

title: "Ghost Town": Brazil Floods A Climate Warning To World, Says UN
content: Record floods that killed over 170 people and displaced half a million in southern Brazil are a warning sign of more disasters to come throughout the Americas because of climate change, an official at the UN' refugee agency said on Tuesday.
summary: Record floods that killed over 170 people and displaced half a million in southern Brazil are a warning sign of more disasters to come throughout the Americas because of climate change, an official at the UN' refugee agency said on Tuesday.

title: Kenyan President Vows "Full Response" As Anti-Tax Protests Intensify
content: Kenya's President William Ruto vowed to take a tough line against "violence and anarchy" on Tuesday, after protests against his government's proposed tax hikes turned deadly and demonstrators ransacked parliament.
summary: Kenya's President William Ruto vowed to take a tough line against "violence and anarchy" on Tuesday, after protests against his government's proposed tax hikes turned deadly and demonstrators ransacked parliament.

title: Five Killed In Las Vegas Shooting, Suspect Arrested: Report
content: Police in North Las Vegas on Tuesday captured a man they suspect shot and killed five people in an apartment complex, according to local media reports.
summary: Police in North Las Vegas on Tuesday captured a man they suspect shot and killed five people in an apartment complex, according to local media reports.

title: Bangladesh PM Says Will Gauge India, China Proposals On Teesta Project
content: Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina said on Tuesday that Bangladesh would gauge proposals from both India and China to build a mega project on the cross-border Teesta River involving a reservoir and accept the better one for her country.
summary: Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina said on Tuesday that Bangladesh would gauge proposals from both India and China to build a mega project on the cross-border Teesta River involving a reservoir and accept the better one for her country.

title: Setback For Canada's Trudeau, Liberals Lose Stronghold In Key Polls
content: In a stunning blow to Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau, his Liberal Party lost a closely-watched federal by-election on Tuesday to the Conservatives from a longtime Liberal stronghold.
summary: In a stunning blow to Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau, his Liberal Party lost a closely-watched federal by-election on Tuesday to the Conservatives from a longtime Liberal stronghold.

title: Gun Violence A Public Health Crisis In US, Declares Surgeon General
content: In a new advisory released on Tuesday, US Surgeon General Dr Vivek Murthy said that gun violence in the country is an urgent public health crisis that demands the "collective commitment of the nation" to put an end to it, reported CNN.
summary: In a new advisory released on Tuesday, US Surgeon General Dr Vivek Murthy said that gun violence in the country is an urgent public health crisis that demands the "collective commitment of the nation" to put an end to it, reported CNN.

title: Russia Bans Distribution Of 81 EU News Outlets In Retaliatory Step
content: Russia said on Tuesday it was banning access inside Russia to the broadcasts of 81 different media outlets from the European Union including Agence France-Presse and Politico in retaliation for a similar EU ban on several Russian media outlets.
summary: Russia said on Tuesday it was banning access inside Russia to the broadcasts of 81 different media outlets from the European Union including Agence France-Presse and Politico in retaliation for a similar EU ban on several Russian media outlets.

title: Explained: How Boeing's Starliner Can Bring Astronauts Back To Earth
content: Problems with Boeing's Starliner capsule, still docked at the International Space Station (ISS), have upended the original plans for its return of its two astronauts to Earth
summary: Problems with Boeing's Starliner capsule, still docked at the International Space Station (ISS), have upended the original plans for its return of its two astronauts to Earth

title: King Charles Welcomes Japan's Emperor Naruhito, Wife For State Visit
content: Britain's King Charles and Queen Camilla welcomed Japan's Emperor Naruhito and his wife to London on Tuesday, marking the start of a three-day state visit which includes a military parade, carriage procession and state banquet.
summary: Britain's King Charles and Queen Camilla welcomed Japan's Emperor Naruhito and his wife to London on Tuesday, marking the start of a three-day state visit which includes a military parade, carriage procession and state banquet.

title: 10 Children Losing 1 Or Both Legs On Average In Gaza, Says UN Agency
content: Ten children per day are losing one or both of their legs in the war in Gaza, the head of the UN agency supporting Palestinian refugees said Tuesday.
summary: Ten children per day are losing one or both of their legs in the war in Gaza, the head of the UN agency supporting Palestinian refugees said Tuesday.

title: Chanel Holds Fashion Week Show After Abrupt Departure Of Creative Director
content: Awkward! Chanel held its haute couture show on Tuesday just three weeks after the very abrupt departure of creative director Virginie Viard after almost 30 years with the brand.
summary: Awkward! Chanel held its haute couture show on Tuesday just three weeks after the very abrupt departure of creative director Virginie Viard after almost 30 years with the brand.

title: Hiker's 3-Hour Trek Turns Into 10-Day Ordeal, Drinks Boot Water To Survive
content: Lukas McClish, a 34-year-old from Boulder Creek, California, went missing for 10 days in the Santa Cruz Mountains after setting out for a day hike on June 11th.
summary: Lukas McClish, a 34-year-old from Boulder Creek, California, went missing for 10 days in the Santa Cruz Mountains after setting out for a day hike on June 11th.

title: Barack Obama's Half-Sister Among Protesters Tear-Gassed In Kenya: Report
content: Kenyan activist Auma Obama, the half-sister of former U.S. President Barack Obama, was among protesters tear-gassed on Tuesday during demonstrations outside the parliament building in Nairobi, a CNN interview showed.
summary: Kenyan activist Auma Obama, the half-sister of former U.S. President Barack Obama, was among protesters tear-gassed on Tuesday during demonstrations outside the parliament building in Nairobi, a CNN interview showed.

title: Illegal Migrant, On Bail And Under Surveillance, Rapes, Kills 12-Year-Old
content: During the hearing, the judge set Ramos' bail at $10 million, which exceeded the $5 million requested by prosecutors.
summary: During the hearing, the judge set Ramos' bail at $10 million, which exceeded the $5 million requested by prosecutors.

title: Jay Slater: All About UK Teen Missing In Tenerife For Over A Week
content: Jay Slater, a 19-year-old from Oswaldtwistle, Lancashire, disappeared while on vacation in Tenerife after attending a music festival with friends.
summary: Jay Slater, a 19-year-old from Oswaldtwistle, Lancashire, disappeared while on vacation in Tenerife after attending a music festival with friends.

title: "Unacceptably High": Alcohol Kills Nearly 3 Million Every Year, Says WHO
content: Alcohol kills nearly three million people annually, the World Health Organization said on Tuesday, adding that while the death rate had dropped slightly in recent years it remained "unacceptably high".
summary: Alcohol kills nearly three million people annually, the World Health Organization said on Tuesday, adding that while the death rate had dropped slightly in recent years it remained "unacceptably high".

title: Pakistan To Re-Install Maharaja Ranjit Singh's Statue At Kartarpur Sahib
content: Pakistan's Punjab government said on Tuesday that it will install the restored statue of the first ruler of the Sikh Empire, Maharaja Ranjit Singh, at Kartarpur Sahib on Wednesday so that visiting Sikhs from India would get to view it too.
summary: Pakistan's Punjab government said on Tuesday that it will install the restored statue of the first ruler of the Sikh Empire, Maharaja Ranjit Singh, at Kartarpur Sahib on Wednesday so that visiting Sikhs from India would get to view it too.

title: Court Frees Man Of Rape Charges As Woman Took 'Too Long' To React
content: The case centres around Raffaele Meola, a former trade union official, who was accused of groping the attendant in 2018.
summary: The case centres around Raffaele Meola, a former trade union official, who was accused of groping the attendant in 2018.

title: US Reacts To Video Of Injured Palestinian Tied To Israeli Military Jeep
content: The US State Department on Monday said a video of a wounded Palestinian man strapped on a military jeep by Israeli forces was "shocking" and urged a swift investigation to hold those responsible to account.
summary: The US State Department on Monday said a video of a wounded Palestinian man strapped on a military jeep by Israeli forces was "shocking" and urged a swift investigation to hold those responsible to account.
